definition: lapel/overlap of Chinese gown/fig. bosom (the seat of emotions)/to cherish (ambition, desires, honorable intentions etc) in one's bosom

sentences.english: A tolerant person usually has breadth of mind.
sentences.chinese: 有寬容精神的人通常胸襟開闊。

sentences.english: He has a mind to become a revolutionary.
A person's mind can be judged by seeing how he would react to defeat and betray.
sentences.chinese: 看一個人的胸襟，要看他如何面對失敗及被人出賣。

sentences.english: Looking to the future, broad-minded, with wisdom creates value.
sentences.chinese: 放眼未來，胸襟開闊，用智慧創造價值。

sentences.english: The ocean, as kind -hearted large-minded people, it accepted everything.
sentences.chinese: 遼闊的大海，如同善良人的寬大胸襟，它接納了一切。

sentences.english: We need to be open-minded and farsighted.
sentences.chinese: 我們需要放開胸襟，放長眼光。

sentences.english: This kind of attitude and mind, is the man.
sentences.chinese: 這種心態和胸襟，纔是人。

sentences.english: Bin Laden's seeming temperance made his manifest bloody-mindedness all the harder to fathom.
sentences.chinese: 拉登的表現似乎讓他戒酒血腥的胸襟所有難以企及的。

sentences.english: He didn't force himself to dream big and to expand the company too fast.
sentences.chinese: 他沒有強迫自己去襟懷胸襟大志或是去迅速擴張公司。

sentences.english: Love is really selfish, is also not tolerate any broad-minded.
sentences.chinese: 愛情真的很自私，一點也容不得半點寬闊的胸襟。

sentences.english: The company has been creating miracles carrying the mind of sea and the passion of fire.
sentences.chinese: 他承載着海的胸襟與火的激情，不斷的創造着奇蹟。

sentences.english: He is a little man with a little mind.
sentences.chinese: 他是一個胸襟狹窄的小人。

sentences.english: But she was broad-minded, therefore, it was always easy to get on well with her.
sentences.chinese: 但她胸襟開闊，所以大家總是很容易和她融洽相處。

sentences.english: He succeeded because of his ambition and generous spirit.
sentences.chinese: 他成功了，因爲他有雄心壯志，還有寬廣的胸襟。

sentences.english: People who like travelling feel broad-minded.
sentences.chinese: 喜歡旅行的人感到胸襟開闊。

definition: one's bosom (the seat of emotions)/breast/broad-minded and open/to think about/to cherish
receptive as an echoing canyon (idiom); modest and open-minded
